  • Field Details

    • initialPlayerAttributes

      public final int[] initialPlayerAttributes
      starting Endurance, Intelligence, Strength, Dexterity, Luck stats of player at level 1

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player​(int[] position, Letter letter, int[] screenRadius)
      Starting player at level 1

    • Player

      public Player​(int[] position, Letter letter, int[] screenRadius, int gold, int[] playerAttributes, java.util.HashMap playerStats, java.util.ArrayList<item_package.Item> inventory, item_package.Item[] eq)
      Fully parameterized player Starting player at level 1
      Parameters:
      position - array with 2 ints representing the player coordinates on the map, index 0 = Y, index 1 = X.
      letter - letter representing player on the map
      screenRadius - array representing how far player can see on the map
      gold - total player gold
      playerAttributes - Endurance, Intelligence, Strength, Dexterity, Luck
      playerStats - max health, max mana, initiative, spell power, dodge bonus, defence, accuracy
      inventory - all player items
      current - equipment being used by player

      public Player()

  • Method Details

    • fillInitialPlayerThings

      public void fillInitialPlayerThings()
      Called in constructor when player object gets created. Fills the remaining player variables to default(level 1).

    • updatePlayerAttsMap

      public void updatePlayerAttsMap()
      update hashMap playerAttributes1 with current playerAttributes which is int[] needs to be called every time playerAttributes is changed

      How much exp does player require for next level?
      Parameters:
      level - = current player level

    • addPlayerExp

      public void addPlayerExp​(int exp)
      add exp to total player exp, update player level if exp conditions are met.
      Parameters:
      exp - exp gained from doing action like defeating enemy of completing quest

    • equipBestEq

      public void equipBestEq()
      split each item into subtype (int itemType), then find best piece of equipment for this specific type of e first split player inventory into categories, weapons, armours, helmets etc. Then based on selected criteria equip this item for player. criteria = for weapons best total damage is chosen, for armor and helmets highest armour items will be chosen. equipBestEq() finds specific item types in whole player inventory, then sends all same type items to findBestEqItem() for it to find best item.

    • test

      public void test()

    • findBestEqItem

      public item_package.Item findBestEqItem​(int itemType, java.util.ArrayList<item_package.Item> tempItemStyle)
      Find strongest item for player to wear out of tempItemStyle which is arrayList of Item with all items with itemType type in playre possession.

    • equipBaseEq

      public item_package.Item equipBaseEq​(item_package.Item baseItem, int itemType)
      If no items of this class before were found equip base items, e.g fists for weapon, no helmet/armor for helmet and armor respectively.

    • findStrongestWeapon1

      public item_package.Item findStrongestWeapon1​(java.util.ArrayList<item_package.Item> tempItemStyle)
      Find strongest weapon based on their one strongest attack type from array.
